alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 19 at 5:53AM MDT until April 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches at lower elevations and 6 to 12 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Up to 6 additional inches of snow may fall in the mountains tonight through Thursday morning before snow ends. An extension of the Winter Storm Warning or a Winter Weather Advisory may be required for the additional snow.
info.instruction: To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine
